actionConfiguration.body: SELECT count(id), TO_CHAR("createdAt" :: DATE, 'dd/mm/yyyy') as sign_up_date FROM users GROUP BY sign_up_date ORDER BY sign_up_date limit 31;

children.text: {{appsmith.mode !== "EDIT" ? "Edit this application to begin" : "Display Chart Data"}}
This page demonstrates how to display data in a chart

üí° The chart displays data returned by the getSignupCount Query. The data is bound to the chart property using
{{ "{{ getSignupCount.data }}" }}

üå™Ô∏è The chart maps over the data returned by getSignupCount and transforms it to an Array of (x,y).

actionConfiguration.body: SELECT count(id), TO_CHAR("createdAt" :: DATE, 'dd/mm/yyyy') as sign_up_date FROM users where "createdAt" >= '{{startDatePicker.selectedDate}}' and "createdAt" <= '{{endDatePicker.selectedDate}}' GROUP BY sign_up_date ORDER BY sign_up_date;

children.text: {{appsmith.mode !== "EDIT" ? "Edit this application to begin" : "Filter Chart Data"}}

üí° The chart displays data returned by the getFilteredSignupCount Query.

üìÖ The getFilteredSignupCount Query reads the values of the startDatePicker and endDatePicker to filter the query. The Date Pickers execute the query onDateSelected

actionConfiguration.body: SELECT products.* FROM products inner join "orderProductMap" on products."productId" = "orderProductMap"."productId" where "orderProductMap"."orderId" = {{ordersTable.selectedRow.id}} ORDER BY id LIMIT 10;
SELECT * FROM orders where "userId"={{usersTable.selectedRow.id}} ORDER BY status LIMIT 10;
SELECT * FROM users where email ilike '%{{usersTable.searchText}}%' ORDER BY id LIMIT 10 offset {{(usersTable.pageNo - 1) * 10}}
UPDATE users SET name = '{{nameInput.text}}', address = '{{addressInput.text}}', email = '{{emailInput.text}}', "phoneNo" = '{{phoneInput.text}}' WHERE id = {{usersTable.selectedRow.id}}

actionConfiguration.body: SELECT * FROM users where email = '{{appsmith.URL.queryParams.email}}' ORDER BY id LIMIT 1;

UPDATE users
  SET name = '{{nameInput.text}}',
  email = '{{emailInput.text}}',
  gender = '{{genderDropdown.selectedOptionValue}}',
  dob = '{{dobPicker.selectedDate}}'
  WHERE id = {{fetchUserByUrlParam.data[0].id}};

children.text: {{appsmith.mode !== "EDIT" ? "Edit this application to begin" : "Pre-Fill Form Fields"}}
This page demonstrates how forms can be pre-filled with data passed from another page through a url param

üîç Inspect the table properties & the input widgets & the fetchUserByUrlParam Query.

üîÑ Refresh the page with an email query param in the URL
Trigger the navigate action from a button and pass a query param to the function. (Inspect refreshButton)

üí° On Page Load, the fetchUserByUrlParam Query is run. The query reads the email query param in the URL to fetch the relevant user.
The default property of the form input widgets are bound to the response of the fetchUserByUrlParam Query

actionConfiguration.body: SELECT * FROM users ORDER BY id LIMIT 5 offset {{(usersTable.pageNo - 1) * 5}};

children.text: {{appsmith.mode !== "EDIT" ? "Edit this application to begin" : "Displaying Data in a Table"}}
This page demonstrates how Tables can display data from APIs & DB Queries, paginated the data & transform it to suit the widget

üí° The table fetches data via the getUsers Query. The data is bound to the table property using{{ "{{ getUsers.data }}" }}.

üìÑThe getUsers Query takes the pageNo of the table to paginate the request using
{{"{{ usersTable.pageNo }}"}} in the query.
The table has server side pagination enabled and executes the query on page change.

children.label: Data

children.text:
üå©Ô∏è Often data returned by an API is not in the format the table requires. To convert the data to the correct format, we use Javascript and transform the data in the table data property.

üå™Ô∏è The table maps over the data returned by getUsersAPI, changes the status field to lowercase and formats the date field.

üß± APIs, Queries and Widgets are all objects of the application exposed via Javascript inside {{"{{}}"}}

üîç Inspect the table properties.

üî† Try updating the function in the table property and format the status field to begin with a capital letter!

üîç Inspect the table properties & the getUsers Query.

üåü Try navigating through the table's pages.

actionConfiguration.body:
SELECT * FROM users where gender {{filterDropdown.selectedOptionValue === "ALL" ? "IN ('Male','Female')" : 
"= '" + filterDropdown.selectedOptionValue + "'"}} AND name ilike '%{{usersTable.searchText || ""}}%' ORDER BY id LIMIT 10 offset {{ (usersTable.pageNo - 1) * 10 }};

children.text: This page demonstrates how to perform server side searching and filtering of datra. (Client side is enabled by default)

üí° The usersTable displays data returned by the getSearchedUsers Query.

üîª The filterDropdown contains options to filter the users by gender. The dropdown executes the getSearchedUsers Query onOptionSelected.

‚ùìThe getSearchedUsers Query has a where clause that reads it's values from the filterDropdown and usersTable.searchText

‚úÖ The getSearchedUsers Query uses conditional checks to modify the where clause when the ALL option is selected and no searchText is present

üîç Inspect the filterDropdown properties & the getSearchedUsers Query.

üîç Try searching and filtering the table data.

children.text: {{appsmith.mode !== "EDIT" ? "Edit this application to begin" : "Drilldown Table Data"}}
This page demonstrates how to efficiently display the important columns in a table and to display the row details as a drilldown
{{usersTable.selectedRow ?  "üôé User Details" : "üëà Select a user in the table"}}

üî© The non-essential table columns are hidden and the detailsContainer displays a drill down view of the entire row.

üñºÔ∏è The container is customised with widgets for each column in the table ex. Image widget for avatar.

üîò The widgets are bound to the value of the selectedRow in the usersTable using {{"{{ usersTable.selectedRow.columnName }}"}}

üîç Inspect the widget properties in the detailsContainer.

‚òøÔ∏è Try displaying the users gender in the detailsContainer.

name = '{{nameInput.text}}',

where id = '{{usersTable.selectedRow.id}}'

children.text: {{appsmith.mode !== "EDIT" ? "Edit this application to begin" : "Editing Table Data"}}
Add a radio buttin for gender and bind it to the update query
This page demonstrates how to edit data displayed in a table

üñãÔ∏è The table has an 'Edit' row action which opens a modal.

üîå The modal contains input widgets with default values bound to the {{"{{ usersTable.selectedRow }}"}}.

üîò The updateButton in the modal executes the updateUser Query, executes the getUsersToEdit Query onSuccess and then closes the modal.

‚úçüèª This workflow which needs more than 2 steps is configured by converting the onClick field to JS.

üîç Inspect the table properties & the modal (Click Edit).

üåü Add a gender field to the modal & connect it to the updateUser Query.
